    Installation_and_configuration Ngme2 Models

    Specifying a latent process model (wrapper function for each model)

    f.Rd

    Function used for defining of smooth and spatial terms within ngme model formulae. The function is a wrapper function for specific submodels. (see ngme_models_types() for available models).

    Usage

    f(
  index = NULL,
  model = "ar1",
  replicates = NULL,
  noise = noise_normal(),
  control = ngme_control_f(),
  data = NULL,
  A = NULL,
  A_pred = NULL,
  theta_K = NULL,
  W = NULL,
  fix_W = NULL,
  fix_theta_K = NULL,
  index_pred = NULL,
  debug = NULL,
  index_NA = NULL,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    index

    symbol or numerical value: index or covariates to build index

    model

    1. string: type of model, 2. ngme.spde object

    replicates

    Representing the replicates

    noise

    1. string: type of model, 2. ngme.noise object (can also be specified in each ngme model)

    control

    control variables for f model

    data

    specifed or inherit from ngme formula

    A

    A Matrix connecting observation and mesh

    A_pred

    A Matrix connecting NA location and mesh

    theta_K

    Unbounded parameter for K

    W

    starting value of the process

    fix_W

    stop sampling for W

    fix_theta_K

    fix the estimation for theta_K.

    index_pred

    index for prediction

    debug

    Debug mode

    index_NA

    Logical vector, same as is.na(response var.)

    ...

    additional arguments inherit the data from ngme function

    Value

    a list latent_in for constructing latent model, e.g. A, h, C, G, which also has 1. Information about K matrix 2. Information about noise 3. Control variables

    On this page
